heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 08 October 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 2.3°C) and feels like temperature (down 1.8°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 8.2°C), dew point temperature (up 6.0°C), outside temperature (up 7.7°C), and cloud levels (up 536 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 203.7m lower than yesterday, 407.6m lower than the past week, 535.7m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 696m and a high of 1841m, averaging 1051.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and little or no wind. Showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dark. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (4.7°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
